result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • David M. Derbas was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:10am [mo]
Defendant David M. Derbas in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " GUILTY  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Derbas   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Derbas

The Court sentences Mr. Derbas   to  5 1/2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  6  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years &  0  months.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  121   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no possession or ingestion of any alcohol
--no operation of any vehicle unless validly licensed, valid insurance and shows agent the IID installed in his vehicle(s)
--no precense at bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel
--to pay restitution in the amount of $1551.49 to Jesse Lurz
---to pay fine in the amount of $2400 plus costs
--to pay blood testing fees in the amount of $56.74
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand


The Court orders:
Revocation of operating privilege: 36 months
IID requirement/restrictions: 36 months
6 demerit points

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 11:32am
Status conference on June 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called 10:08 
Defendant David M. Derbas in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa requests a brief scheduling of another status conference-- he needs more time to discuss a plea-offer with Mr. Derbas
On Motion of ADA Teuber, the Court amends the Criminal Complaint to amend the factual portion in paragraph 5, so that it reflects that the OWI 3rd date of conviction is August 17, 2009.  
recess 10:11am 

NEXT:  Status Conference (likley plea/sentencing) on 6/10/16 at 10:30am
State's

Status conference on May 27, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2016 at 10:20 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 8:36am. 
Defendant David M. Derbas in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Derbas waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:

--pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court continues Bond. 
recess 8:41am. 


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/27/16 at 10:20am    (2) Status Conference on 5/27/16 at 10:00am
Defendant's
Court okays scheduling of Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from the State requesting a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Attorney De La Rosa
Scheduling
Jury trial at 05-02-2016 08:30 am
Final status/scheduling conference at 04-26-2016 10:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 03-16-2016 01:20 pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
From Jefferson County Jail

Case called at 1:19pm [mo]
Defendant David M. Derbas appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Right to Counsel given 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that further evaluation will need to be conducted regarding Mr. Derbas eligibility for SPD representation

The Defendant verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $750  CASH bond, with conditions:
--No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-- No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
The Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 1:29  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/16/16 at 1:20pm   (2) FSSC on 4/26/16 at 10:30am (3)Jury Trial on 5/2 and/or 5/3/2016 at 8:30am
